Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.

III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster Parent Information
Section (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all of the following
Description information before the placement or replacement of a child:
(h) Any other known information to enable the foster parent to
provide a stable, safe, and healthy environment for the foster child
and the foster family, including information about siblings who do
not reside in the foster home.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that the foster parent was not provided any information
about Youth A prior to/at time of placement.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed on 7/25/2023, via telephone.
Several telephone calls were made in an attempt to contact the
complainant on 6/16/23 and 6/21/2023. A message was not left
due to the telephone consistently ringing and no one answered the
call. When contacted, complainant did not report additional
information other than what was reported per the allegation.
History of Youth A:
Youth A, age 13 was placed in the home of Foster Parent 1 from
3/13/23 – 3/28/23. Prior, Youth A was placed with an unlicensed
relative from 10/17/22 – 3/13/23. It is noted that the unrelated
relative transported Youth A to Foster Parent 1’s home for
placement on 3/13/2023. The unrelated relative provided no
documents to Foster Parent 1.
Foster Parent 1 was interviewed on 7/25/2023, via telephone.
Foster Parent 1 reported that Youth A’s Unlicensed relative (Sister)
pulled up in her driveway on 3/13/23 and dropped all of Youth A’s
belonging in her driveway. She said the sister told her that Youth A
was a fine kid. She said she assisted Youth A with his belongings
and went inside the home where she explains her house rules to
Youth A. Foster Parent 1 reported Youth A immediately started
acting out the next day he was place in her home. She said she
was unaware of these behaviors and was not informed of Youth A’s
behaviors from the agency. She said on 03/14/2023, she went to
the store to get milk for Youth A, who wanted to eat cereal. She
said while she was out to the store, Youth A intentionally broke the
valve on the toilet and attempted to flood her home while she was
gone. She said water was everywhere and she had to call a
cleaning company while Youth A through it was funny. She said
Youth A later “gutted” her dog by cutting him open with his long
2

fingernails and regularly “threw shoes and boots” at her son head
while he slept. She reported that Youth A refused to bathe and that
she would not allow him into her kitchen. She said Youth A
displayed the behaviors of “playing with his groin” and “picks his
nose” in front of her. She reported Youth A punches walls and uses
racial and homophobic slurs towards her and her son and the
children in the neighborhood, and on social media. Foster Parent 1
stated that Youth A was told by his relative that he does not need to
listen to Foster Parent 1 and to demand to “talk to his lawyer” if he
does not like something in his foster home. She said she slept on
the couch while Youth A was in her home to ensure the safety of
her animals and her son. According to Foster Parent 1, she did not
receive any paperwork on Youth A until the Foster Care Worker
came to her home on 3/16/2023. According to Foster Parent 1, the
documents presented to her already had her signature on them and
that she did not sign the documents. Foster Parent 1 said the
Foster Care Worker shared bare minimum with her regarding Youth
A’s behaviors.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed on 6/30/23, via video
conference. She reported Youth A’s sister dropped him off to
Foster Parent 1’s home on 3/13/23, because Foster Parent 1 was
very eager to get him into her home. FCW said Foster Parent 1
even offered to go and pick Youth A up from his sister home, but
the sister decided to drop Youth A off at Foster Parent 1’s home
instead. FCW said she went out to the home on March 15th. She
said she was originally supposed to go out to the home the next
day which was March 14th but she received text messages from
Foster Parent 1 stating that Youth A flooded her home and that she
was having a cleaning company come out to the home on that day
because the carpet, sofa and entire living room was wet and she
stated that the cleaning company told her it would take almost 2
days to dry out and ask her not to come. FCW said this was the
only reason she did not go out to the home the following day. FCW
said when she went to Foster Parent 1 home on March 15th, she
took the intake packet which included a ton of documents. More
specially this packet included Youth A’s behaviors prior to being
place with Foster Parent 1 and his medical authorization card. She
said the only known behaviors she had regarding Youth A during
this time was picking on and teasing his brother excessively. She
said at the time those were the only behavior problems that had
been reported from his last placement. She said Foster Parent 1
signed all documents during this meeting as she explained the
documents to Foster Parent 1. She said there were no signatures
on the documents prior to Foster Parent 1 signing them. FCW also
stated that Foster Parent 1 expressed interest in still working with
3

Youth A after he exhibited the above-mentioned behaviors. She
said Foster Parent 1 did not express a removal of Youth A.
Foster Care Supervisor (FCS) was interviewed on 7/28/2023.
FCS interview was delayed due to him being on annual leave and
having a delay in responding back to this Consultant. He reported
during his conversation with Foster Parent 1, he and the Licensing
Supervisor conveyed the concerning situation regarding Youth A’s
current behaviors of flooding the bathroom and hurting her animal
as well as not bathing and attempting to hurt her son as well as his
name calling. He said he emphasized that Youth A had been
engaging in persistent negative behaviors towards his brother while
in his prior placement, exacerbating trauma and discord within the
relative household. FCS reported the relative caregiver, who had
been providing care for both youths (her siblings), expressed her
inability to continue caring for them any longer. FCS reported that
during the discussion with Foster Parent 1 there was no additional
issues or concerns reported to the agency by the relative caregiver
regarding his behaviors prior to being placed in Foster Parent 1’s
home. He said the focus now was primarily on addressing the
immediate matter of Youth A's behavior and its impact in Foster
Parent 1 home. FCS said as the conversation proceeded, he and
the Licensing Supervisor were attentive to Foster Parent 1's
perspective to ensure a thorough exchange of information. He said
they wanted to provide as much support to Foster Parent 1 as they
could because it was difficult to place teenagers in foster homes.
The FCS reported following the conversation with Foster Parent 1,
Foster Parent 1 expressed her reassurance to the agency, affirming
that she was well-equipped and experienced in working with youth
who have specific needs, such as trauma and bullying. He said
throughout the discussion, Foster Parent 1 was informed about the
reasons behind Youth A’s placement into care. He said this
information enabled Foster Parent 1 to gain insights into the
circumstances that led to Youth A’s current situation, including the
decision to move him out of the home where his brother resides
and the underlying reasons for his bullying behavior. FCS said
Foster Parent 1 acknowledgment of the factors contributing to
Youth A's challenges demonstrated her understanding of the
complexities involved. FCS said during this conversation and the
fact that Foster Parent 1 had experience these types of behaviors in
Foster Parent 1’s home, Foster Parent 1 did not ask for Youth A’s
immediate removal.
FCS denied providing any documents to Foster Parent 1 that was
already signed.
4

Documentation reviewed:
Placement History:
Youth A had 8 different placements, five with relatives beginning
12/20/2014 and 3 unrelated foster homes.
Updated Service Plan:
Updated Service Plan dated 2/9/23 – 5/9/23, this report discussed
the behaviors mentioned above in Foster Parent 1’s home
regarding Youth A and the flooding of the toilet.
Medical Passport of Youth A:
It was documented that in October of 2022, Youth A was prescribed
the psychotropic medications Guanfacine HCL Er 2 mg and
Ariprazole 2Mg. The report did not disclose when Youth A stop
taking the medications.
Analysis Youth A was place in the home of Foster Parent 1 on 3/13/2023
whereby he was dropped off at her home by his relative. The
Foster Care Worker reported she was taking Youth A’s paperwork
to Foster Parent 1 on 3/14/2023 along with the only behaviors she
was informed of at that time however, received text messages from
Foster Parent 1 stating her home was flooded by Youth A and
Foster Parent 1 ask for a delay in a home visit due to having a
cleaning company coming into her home and that her home needed
to dry out. FCW reported she took an intake packet to Foster
Parent 1 that included Youth A’s behaviors during that time. She
said she shared this information with Foster Parent 1. Foster Parent
1 admitted that FCW came to her home and provided her with
documents and bare minimum information regarding Youth A’s
behaviors on or about 3/15/23 or 3/16/23. Based on interviews
from the FCW and the Foster Parent, Foster Parent 1 did not
receive the needed information on Youth A per the rule before
Youth A was placed in her home.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster Parent Information
Section (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all of the following
Description information before the placement or replacement of a child:
(j) Authorization to provide routine and emergency medical care.
5

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged the foster parent was not provided with Youth A's
medical authorization at time of placement.
Investigation Foster Care Worker was interviewed on 6/30/2023, via video
conference. She reported she provided Foster Parent 1 with Youth
A’s medical authorization card along with other documents that was
in Foster Parent 1’s intake packet when she visited the home on
3/15/2023. Some of the other documents included the agency
policies and procedures, trauma assessment, parent/agency
agreement and others. These forms were signed by Foster Parent
1 with the date of 3/15/2023.
Analysis This Consultant reviewed a copy of Youth A’s medical authorization
card. This document was included with the intake packet given to
Foster Parent 1 on 3/15/2023. It is determined that the medical
authorization card was not presented to Foster Parent 1 until
3/15/2023.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that Forever Families Inc. current license status be continued.
